title: Yubikey passthrough via RDP to a Windows Server?
author: AdrianKielbowicz
body_snippet: Can Yubikeys be used within mRemoteNG and passed through to an RDP session for authentication?

comments.author: simonai1254
comments.snippet:
mRemoteNG offers the Options to Redirect SmartCards in RDP Sessions, so I think YubiKey should be passed through as well. Did you try that?

Otherwise I guess it will be required to add a new feature to support the option, the Framework itself for sure does allow it (it relies on the Microsoft RDP Library).

comments.author: pl31
comments.snippet:
It seems to depend on the Yubikey. 

- Some YubiKeys have SmartCard-Driver. Those should work.
- Other YubiKeys only support Fido2/WebAuthn, those do not work, yet. They work using "standard" Windows RDP. There is an extra checkbox for local ressources, called "WebAuthn (Windows hello or secure key)"

comments.author: ttamttam
comments.snippet:
For my security key (not a yubi key, but still…) to work through RDP (tested with windows stock Remote Desktop Connection), I have to add the following option in the RDP file:

redirectwebauthn:i:1

Hoping this helps.

comments.author: robertpopa22
comments.snippet:
Thanks for the detailed reproduction steps! This is a known limitation — mRemoteNG currently does not expose the `redirectwebauthn:i:1` RDP option that enables FIDO2/WebAuthn passkey forwarding.

The community discussion here already identified the technical path: the newer RDP client interfaces would need a WebAuthn redirect property added to the connection settings, similar to how SmartCard and printer redirection work today.
